title: Alternatives Gain Favor With Latin American Investors
sub_head: A rising appetite for alternative investments among pensions drives global private-equity expansion in the region
body:
Institutional investors in Latin America are showing increased appetite for alternative assets, and global private-equity firms are taking notice.
So-called alternative investments now account for roughly 5% to 7%, or as much as $30 billion, of nearly $450 billion in assets held by pension funds in Chile, Peru, Colombia and Mexico, according to Philippe Stiernon, chief executive and managing partner of Roam Capital, a Latin America-focused placement agent.
